31648295.review: Очень милая и красочная игруля. Сначала кажется что все просто и легко, но иногда голову пришлось поломать. Так же игра не обделена изюминками юмора.

27999813.review: A fantasic yet widley overlooked puzzle game. If you looking for a ton of fun under $10 then you've found it!

26242222.review:
This child friendly game is quite cute looking, but looks can be deceiving. At it's core, it is really a difficult puzzler game with side quests..

A young child about 7 will enjoy this game, but so will adults. Due to the difficulty of the puzzles, some of them are quite challenging. Each puzzle level has 3 main goals. Usually one consists of eating all the cake on each level, where the other 2 are usually random, and include beating level in time limit, do not kill enemies, do not use certain powers, etc...

The monsters that join you look cute in the game, but in actuality, each has a unique ability that can get you thru most mazes and puzzles. Advanced strategies require the main character to equip specific costumes to pass levels.

Recommended for all ages of games for difficulty of puzzles and funny storyline and whimsical graphics.

21120140.review: You know, every puzzle game tries to have it's own little unique thing. This title is way more unique than other puzzlers. Definitely try this title.

20698234.review:
[h1]Presentación[/h1]
El planteamiento es muy simple: Eres un niño al que unos monstruos le han robado su pastel de cumpleaños, y vas tras ellos para recuperarlo. Según progreses en la aventura, irás descubriendo que hay otros motivos para perseguir a los ladrones, pero la historia no deja de ser un cuentecillo narrado con bastante buen humor.
Los gráficos son muy bonitos, tan alegres y resultones como corresponde a este tipo de historia. Siempre resulta fácil identificar los elementos interactivos de cada nivel y también los peligros.
La música sigue el mismo enfoque: relativamente sencilla, pero bonita, con algunos toques bastante imaginativos y perfectamente adecuada a cada momento. Llegué a rejugar alguno de los niveles que tenían mi melodía favorita, sólo para volver a escucharla. En [url=http://music.disasterpeace.com/album/monsters-ate-my-birthday-cake-ost]este enlace[/url] puede escucharse la banda sonora del juego.

[h1]Jugabilidad[/h1]
El juego consiste básicamente en ir superando pequeños niveles, donde el objetivo principal es recoger todos los trozos de pastel dispersos por ellos (también hay otros objetivos opcionales). Para llegar a cada trozo, tienes que usar las habilidades del niño protagonista (al principio, sólo puede arrastrar bloques) y las de ciertos monstruos que se irán uniendo a ti a lo largo del viaje. La dificultad se basa siempre en descubrir dónde y cuándo usar el poder de cada uno de tus personajes, para alcanzar todos los trozos de pastel. Hay enemigos, pero evitarlos es fácil y también tendrás que aprender a servirte de ellos. No es un juego que requiera gran precisión de movimientos, si no pensar. Más que un arcade, es un juego de puzzles.
Dentro de este género, también tiene una característica que me encanta: Te permite equivocarte. Por ejemplo, si necesitas a un enemigo para completar el nivel y muere accidentalmente, reaparece automáticamente en su posición original. Es muy raro encontrarte en una situación de bloqueo en que no tengas más remedio que reiniciar el nivel (a mí sólo me pasó una vez).
La duración me parece muy bien ajustada. El juego consta de unos pocos mundos compuestos de bastantes niveles, y en todo momento tienes la posibilidad de volver a tu pueblo para hablar con los habitantes, que a veces te encomiendan misiones adicionales. Según progresas, el juego va introduciendo también nuevos desafíos y habilidades, para dar variedad y mantener el interés.

[h1]Mi valoración[/h1]
Un juego de puzzles simpático y colorista, hecho con mucho mimo y con unas mecánicas de juego muy bien pensadas y ajustadas. Como único defecto, señalaría algunas ocasiones en que uno de mis personajes ha muerto al desactivar un poder, a pesar de que se encontraba ya en una zona donde dicho poder no era necesario; un pequeño bug que sólo he encontrado en un par de ocasiones y que tampoco empaña la experiencia.
En resumen, una delicia de juego.

20569966.review:
Joué sur PC à la manette, excellent petit jeu de réflexion, tout en français.
Différents personnages avec différents pouvoirs, des monstres, des casse-têtes, un design réussi (personnages comme niveaux), une musique agréable, des niveaux rapides mais nombreux, la sauce prend bien, et il a l'avantage de tourner sur de petites configurations :)

20552891.review: Generally, I'm pretty bad at puzzle games. However, Monsters Ate My Birthday Cake is a puzzle game with such a adorable theme and reasonable puzzles that not only did I finish the game, but I had the interest and motivation to obtain every star for every level and obtain all the costumes as well. It's hard to put my finger on what it is that is attractive and addictive about this game, but I would highly recommend it as something to play when you're having a hard day, and just need some attention-grabbing and fun distraction.

19139958.review: Pleasant little puzzle game with fun art and story.  A few puzzles were sort of "groaners", but most were fair and some were even reasonably challenging.  Doesn't overstay its welcome or force you to grind through repetitive fluff.  Solid.

18846969.review:
Is it cute? Yes. Is it fun? Eh...

Truth be told, I'm not sure how epic the story gets because I am still crawling through the first world. The gameplay is clever, but it feels a bit mechanical. You'll have to replay a tricky level to get the timing right, to find the simple solutions that tend to hide in plain sight. If you want all the in-game achievements, you're replaying some of these levels a few times each. The world feels small, because it's a series of short levels to puzzle through in 2 minutes or less. After a few mini-levels in a row, you'll gain a small tidbit of story to move forward with. 

This game seems to hinge on whether you enjoy the gameplay or not. I'm not a huge fan of it. I prefer my puzzlers to be a bit faster, spontaneous and unpredictable. There's not a lot of surprise here. You either make the right turns or you don't. If you do, awesome, time for the next similar level. If you don't, try again. Rinse, repeat.

The design is clever, and the characters are cute. But they feel a bit flat, with minimal dialogue and few defining characteristics. The story seems to unravel a bit slowly (what little story there is). I give them credit for including a story, but I'd love more of it. There is good humor in this title, but other reviewers seem to find it funnier than I did. (Some of the characters communicate with emoticons, to give you an idea.)

I've picked this one up multiple times to try and get engaged, but no dice. By no means is it a bad game, or a waste of money. I'm just a bit disinterested so I feel like I could've spent the few dollars on a more addictive puzzler. YMMV.

PS: Get it on sale.

18835711.review:

18275231.review:
잊혀진 케이크를 찾기 위한 본격 역할분담 게임.

케이크를 찾기 위한 여정을 함께 할 다양한 몬스터들이 등장하고, 게임은 이 몬스터들과의 협력을 바탕으로 진행된다. 일단은 발랄하고 화사한 분위기가 상당히 인상적인데, 험상궂은(이라고 썼지만, 이 수식어를 사용하기엔 너무나도 깜찍하고 귀엽기만 한) 몬스터들이 많이 나오지만 주인공은 그저 자기 생일 케잌 찾는데에만 정신이 팔려있다. 더도말고 덜도말고 딱 유아틱한 분위기가 인상적이다.

다양한 능력을 지닌 몬스터들이 등장한다. 그리고 그 몬스터들을 적재적소에 활용하도록 레벨들이 상당히 구성이 잘 되어있다. 플레이하면서 놀란 부분이 바로 이 점인데, 각 레벨들이 생각보다 정교하게 구성되어있어 플레이하면서 꽤 감탄을 했다. 단 일부 스테이지의 경우 주인공 니코의 추가 의상을 통해 조금 더 쉽게 진행할 수 있는 꼼수성 플레이가 존재하긴 한다.

또한 주인공 니코의 추가 의상과 별 3개를 목표로 한 플레이, 그리고 그 밖에 부수적인 추가 퀘스트 같은 것들도 상당히 준비가 잘 되어있다. 본편 이외의 즐길 거리도 '나름' 잘 갖춘 편. 그저 단순한 유아용 게임처럼 보이는 외관에 비해, 즐길거리가 꽤 쏠쏠한 게임이기도 하다.

게임 자체도 크게 어렵지 않은데다가, 한글화가 된 게임이라는 대한민국 게이머로써는 절대 무시할 수 없는 메리트가 있다. 크게 어렵지 않은 게임을 선호하는 이들이라면 만족하며 즐길 수 있을 것이다.

17953682.review:
[h1]Monsters [i]Started to[/i] Eat My Birthday Cake[/h1]

I discovered this game because Disasterpeace composed the soundtrack and I adore Disasterpeace. Anything he works on I look into. I added this game to wishlist and waited for a sale... I can't remember if I bought it on sale or got impatient and purchased regardless, but after playing through it I think it is worth the price they ask!

This game follows the adventures of Niko, a young boy whose particular birthday becomes the second worst birthday ever, thanks to the Monsters that--you guessed it--Ate [His] Birthday Cake, although I feel like that's not entirely true, as the premise of the game has you trekking across worlds acquiring discarded slices of the cake itself. Admittedly though, "Monsters Took My Birthday Cake and Strew it Across the Island for Little Apparent Reason" doesn't quite have a ring to it...

Along the journey, Niko makes friends with a cast of eclectic and quirky characters, each of which has a special ability that helps the player to solve puzzles and progress through the levels. The levels are accessible through a "road-map" with each stage being a separate bump in the road (think Super Mario Brothers 3). Even the cutscenes are replayable by entering their "stage".
Each level contains multiple objectives which reward you with a star for each mission completed. This means that there is incentive to replay levels and beat the target time, or find the hidden treasures, etc. The treasures can be traded and compiled with the townsfolk to complete side quests and unlock costumes for Niko. These costumes are vital, as some costumes give Niko new abilities  that allow access into parts of the levels that are otherwise unreachable. 

All in all, this is a very enjoyable game! It challenges your mind and coordination without being unreasonable, and provides a lot of laughs. The humor can be a bit childish sometimes, but it's the youthful demeanor that makes this game what it is. I have played it on Android and on PC, and I prefer PC. Touch controls just never appealed to me as much as the precision of a keyboard.

And then I bought [url=http://music.disasterpeace.com/album/monsters-ate-my-birthday-cake-ost]the soundtrack.[/url]

16761332.review: I really enjoyed this game. The graphics are simple and charming, the music and sound effects match the ambiance. It's fun and at times you get frustrated because you can't figure out something you know is simple, but I absolutely loved it.

16125825.review: The game was pretty fun. Some challenging puzzles towards the end but nothing too hard. Some of the references were pretty funny and the humor was witty.  I'd give it a 4.5/5. My experience would've been better if the achievements weren't so buggy. You have to quit out of your game and reopen it for them to unlock. If achievements don't mean much to you, and you enjoy a good puzzle, I'd suggest grabbing this game.

15571590.review: A cross-over between Tiny Thief and Chip's Challenge. Highly recommended! Challenging but not too hard puzzles. I liked that the "damsel in distress" was a bearded hiker, rather than a princess. The game even has a thread of a story to it, although some threads are left dangling at the end of the game.  (What happened to the professor? Where are Niko's parents? Can we get to the underwater kingdon? How do we destory Morvath? There's obviously room for a sequel, and I hope that's in the works!)

15428340.review:
I've enjoyed my time with this game.
It's a little puzzle game that tells the story of Niko and his stolen birthday cake. 
At first all he cares about is his cake, but his motives and quest soon change as he finds friendly monsters to help him  along the way.

The artwork is cute, the music is nice and the game is suited for all ages.
It has a decent amount of replay value if you want to collect all the bottles, get all the costumes and get all the extra objectives on all the levels.

What I didn't like:
At some point you get monsters that clear paths for you so that another character can get to a button or just cross an otherwise inaccessible path. 
If the character that crosses the path is only slightly too close to the water, the abyss or near a spike they will die. This caused me a lot of frustration because often times I really made sure the characters weren't near whatever danger they just crossed.

It's still a great game though and I would definitely recommend you play it.

14348345.review: You can say what you want about adorable games but the cuteness level in Monsters Ate My Birthday Cake is beyond measure. The gameplay? Simple. The stylistic design choices? Tooth-achingly sweet. The plot and verbiage? Hilarious and fun. "Oh, Brocolli Farts!" is now my new favorite saying and I ate birthday cake, on my birthday, whilst playing this game... also on my birthday. I was the only monster to devour these pixelated cakes. Whether you are a child, a parent of a child, or an overgrown 30 something lesbo with a peter pan fetish... you are sure to love this game. Also if you are a Bronie, you are probably the type to relish in Monsters Ate My Birthday Cake. Have fun with the cuteness!

13708482.review: This game was everything I expected it to be. It was a nice, short but sweet puzzle game that was super fun and amusing. The game is a bit on the shorter side, myself having completed it 100% in about 12 hours. Though there were harder puzzles near the end, the game's difficulty is not extremely high, leaning more on the casual side. This would be a perfect game for someone who doesn't play puzzle games that much, or for a younger audience. Those are the demographics this game would be best suited for. Though with the visual style and cute little story attached, any puzzle game fan could play this and enjoy it for what it's worth. The game's puzzles were intuitive and fun, making up the majority of the gameplay. There was a mild bit of fetch-questy type quests thrown in here and there as well. I'm aware some people do not care for fetch quests, but I believe they were executed well in this game. The music and atmosphere was very well suited to the game. The songs were not repetitive or annoying but well fitting to the environments, which were also finely crafted. Monsters Ate My Birthday Cake is a fairly funny and wholely heartwarming game that delivers an adorable casual gaming experience.

13432194.review:
キャラクターのデザインがかわいくて音楽も素晴らしい
ほんわかした雰囲気のパズルゲーム。（日本語対応）

主人公のニコが道中で会う仲間達と力を合わせ、
悪者であるブーギンを倒しにいきます。

キャラクターはそれぞれ特殊能力持っていて、それらを使いわけながらパズルを解き、ステージにあるケーキを全部取得すればクリアです。
クリアタイム、コインや宝箱（クエストアイテム）等のチャレンジ要素があるのでステージを1回クリアして、ハイ終わりということもありません。

与えられた問題を解くだけのパズルゲームとは違ってサイドクエスト等もあり、ゲームの舞台であるゴガポエ島の”ゆる～い”雰囲気を味わえます。

”かわいいもの”と”パズルゲーム”が好きな人なら間違いなく楽しめるでしょう。
逆に上記二つの要素に興味が無ければ無理して買う必要ありません。

[i]※日本語対応してるのに日本語のレビューがなかったので書かせていただきました。
（2014ホリデーセール前のオークションにて入手）[/i]

13108120.review:
A fantastic puzzler with great music, art, writing, ... (the list goes on). I was a apprehensive with purchasing this as I feared the game may have been too childish, but this is not the case.

The puzzles definitely get fairly complex. I've only played up to the third world so far, and nothing has been all that challenging, but if the pace continues, the fourth world is going to have some wonderfully difficult challenges. Don't expect something to twist your mind like a puzzle from Braid or FEZ might. The puzzles here rely on the teamwork mechanic. You must control up to four different characters, switching between them, one at a time, and orchestrate their movements in order to progress.

The RPG-esque elements add fun content to the game (which could stand on its own without them). There are always sidequests to complete and new ones pop-up frequently, at least once you complete a world. The secrets aren't that well hidden, which is a little frustrating, but some have been tricky enough to make up for it.

The game definitely has a unique charm. The monsters all have quite different personalities and add a nice flavor to the game. The humor just makes me smile.

Don't go into this game expecting be lost on a puzzle for hours, as none of them are THAT difficult. They will make you think in a different way than you're used to, which is what puzzle games really should do, in my opinion.

9/10

11011219.review:
Monsters Ate My Birthday Cake is an adorable, nostalgic, puzzle solving game with a simple premise; monsters ate your birthday cake. Literally.  
The colors are bright and the shapes are appealing. I can understand why Cartoon Network picked this project up later on. 
As I was using an xbox controller, the controls are obviously different. But it requires little to no effort to do anything in this game. All you need is the left thumbstick, the 'A' button, and your 'LB'/'RB' buttons. 
The dialogue is cute and light with adorable humor. I'll forever use 'broccoli farts' as an endearing way to say 'gas'. 
And of course, the music is light hearted and pleasant.

Now on to the actual game play!
As I pointed out earlier, all you're doing is using your thumbstick to move , the 'A' button to use an action, and your 'LB'/'RB' buttons to change your character when you're in play. 
There are various little obstacles you need to overcome to help clear your way to collect cake pieces. (And some other goodies such as gold coins and keys)
As this is a casual puzzle game, you don't actually die unless you step onto a trap or the boogies get you. 
The only limiter you sort of have is the timer. But you only really care about that if you want your 3 star ranking.
The first two puzzles are extremely easy as they are there to introduce the game mechanics. 
Moving forward, you end up meeting monster friends one by one and they help you solve the various levels so that you can advance. 

So far, this is an absolutely adorable, fun game for all ages.
The only slightly annoying thing I encountered, and I don't know if it was just me, but the music volume would sort of go up and down in the beginning. But after a while it will go back to being consistant. 
I'm glad I donated for this project and I wish the guys at SleepingNinja much success. 
Thanks for such a wonderful and polished game!

11006726.review: This game is so much of a yes. I'm writing a lengthy review of it on Fist Full of Potions, but the short and sweet of it is Buy this game. Rad music, gorgeous visuals, and HILARIOUS dialogue. Really, this was a pleasant surprise.

11002409.review:
Beautifully well-made game. The art is so playful and clean. The puzzles are fun and even become a challenge when you're trying to 3-star a level. Plus the music is done by Disasterpeace so you know it's grand. 

Oh and a unicorn freaking BARFS RAINBOWS!

In case no one can tell from the trailer video, it's a puzzle adventure game with a bunch of cute monsters and villagers in it. It requires some teamwork with these cuties to get all your cake back.

10997132.review: This game is both adorable and a delightful challenge!

Monsters Ate My Birthday Cake is a great puzzle game that shines on PC.  If you love smiling, great art & challenging puzzles, this game is for you.

A Monster barfs rainbows to kill Boogins.

10/10

It's a masterpiece.
